page.title: 05ST.JOHNS CHAPEL MART (2)
page.content: There were lots of farmers outside looking at the animals in the pens. Most of them were Charolais cows. Some of the local farmers had walked their cattle to the mart and we saw some going past school at playtime. Inside it was noisy, smoky and quite dark. Lots of the farmers were sitting on the wooden benches that are around three sides of the ring. Some were standing around the rail on the outside of the ring. They wore caps, waterproof-jackets and wellingtons, some carried sticks. The cows were moved around the ring by a man using a stick. The floor was covered in sawdust. Mr Peart was the auctioneer and he was talking very fast. He had a microphone fixed to his shirt so that people could hear his voice more clearly.
